Sentencas: The present paper reviews anodic reaction mechanisms of porous cermet and model anodes at metal/oxide interfaces in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Materials and reaction mechanisms at anode/electrolyte interfaces for SOFCs

Sentencas: Some analytical results, electrochemical methods, and reaction models were presented at Ni-YSZ cermets and well defined model anodes.
Titulo: Materials and reaction mechanisms at anode/electrolyte interfaces for SOFCs

Sentencas: Isotope labeling/secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) analysis techniques were applied to determine the oxygen surface reactivity of oxide electrolytes in reducing atmospheres.
Titulo: Materials and reaction mechanisms at anode/electrolyte interfaces for SOFCs

Sentencas: The technique was also applied to determine the catalytic activity of metal/oxide interfaces for CH4 decomposition and reactivity with the reformed gases at the mesh or stripe shaped anodes on different oxides.
Titulo: Materials and reaction mechanisms at anode/electrolyte interfaces for SOFCs

Sentencas: Observed SIMS images and the electrochemical analyses were compared at the model anode/electrolyte interfaces.
Titulo: Materials and reaction mechanisms at anode/electrolyte interfaces for SOFCs
